title: Multi-regional monitoring system for the conservation of the Sri Lankan leopard
snippet: The Sri Lankan leopard (Panthera pardus kotiya) is the largest of the four wild cat species found in Sri Lanka, and the apex mammalian predator on the island. The sub-species of this charismatic animal is endemic to Sri Lanka and widely distributed across the island's dry zones and low country wet zones with habitats ranging to the cloud forests of the highest elevations in the hill country.

title: Sri Lanka sees small dip in forex reserves in Feb
